title: Katrina Szish
text:
Katrina Szish ( ) is an American <a href="television%20personality">television personality</a>, broadcaster and journalist, and currently a regular contributor on <a href="Fox%20Business%20Network">Fox Business Network</a> and the <a href="Wendy%20Williams%20Show">Wendy Williams Show</a>. She was an entertainment contributor for <a href="Good%20Afternoon%20America">Good Afternoon America</a> and a contributing correspondent for <a href="The%20Early%20Show">The Early Show</a> on <a href="CBS%20News">CBS News</a>. She is also the current host of <a href="Cindy%20Crawford">Cindy Crawford</a>'s Meaningful Beauty infomercial.
Szish has a background in journalism, having held numerous positions at <a href="fashion%20magazines">fashion magazines</a>, including <a href="YM%20%28magazine%29">YM</a>, <a href="Vogue%20%28magazine%29">VOGUE</a>, and <a href="GQ%20%28magazine%29">GQ magazine</a>. She has worked alongside <a href="Barbara%20Walters">Barbara Walters</a>, <a href="Larry%20King">Larry King</a>, <a href="Diane%20Sawyer">Diane Sawyer</a> and <a href="Bill%20O%27Reilly%20%28political%20commentator%29">Bill O'Reilly</a>. Szish has appeared at the <a href="Oscar%20Awards">Oscar Awards</a> and has interviewed celebrities and designers, including <a href="Justin%20Timberlake">Justin Timberlake</a> and <a href="Oleg%20Cassini">Oleg Cassini</a> (she conducted the last known televised interview with him for <a href="ABC%20News">ABC News</a> prior to his death in 2006), Szish currently lives in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> with her husband, Marc Korczykowski.
Biography.
Szish was born in <a href="Wyomissing%2C%20Pennsylvania">Wyomissing, Pennsylvania</a>, where she grew up an only child, the daughter of Dr. Ronald C. Szish and Maureen Szish. At 13, she was named a national finalist in <a href="YM%20%28magazine%29">YM magazine's</a> <a href="cover%20model">cover model</a> contest and was featured in a fashion editorial spread shot by <a href="Patrick%20Demarchelier">Patrick Demarchelier</a>. She then signed on with CLICK <a href="modeling%20agency">modeling agency</a> in NYC and World Top agency in <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a>, and continued modeling for clients such as <a href="L%27Or%C3%A9al">L'Oréal</a> and <a href="Shiseido">Shiseido</a> through the early 1990s. She graduated from Wyomissing High School at the top of her class in 1990 and was accepted into the <a href="Medill%20School%20of%20Journalism">Medill School of Journalism</a> at <a href="Northwestern%20University">Northwestern University</a>. After completing her sophomore year at Northwestern, she took a year off after being accepted into an <a href="internship">internship</a> program with <a href="CNN">CNN</a>'s Political Investigation Unit in <a href="Washington%2C%20DC">Washington, DC</a>. Szish then transferred to <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a> where she was a member of the <a href="Hasty%20Pudding%20Club">Hasty Pudding Club</a>, wrote for <a href="The%20Harvard%20Crimson">The Harvard Crimson</a> and was a member of the college <a href="television%20station">television station</a>. In 1996, after writing a <a href="thesis">thesis</a> on fashion, <a href="film">film</a> and concepts of <a href="Identity%20%28social%20science%29">identity</a>, she graduated <a href="cum%20laude">cum laude</a> from Harvard with a BA degree in English & American Literature and Language.
Career.
Magazines.
After completing an internship with CNN's Style with <a href="Elsa%20Klensch">Elsa Klensch</a> in New York City, Szish joined <a href="GQ%20%28magazine%29">GQ magazine</a> as an editorial assistant and writer. She was later named a fashion writer/<a href="editing">editor</a> at <a href="Vogue%20%28magazine%29">VOGUE</a>, where she wrote and edited "Scoop", a monthly trend column in addition to covering <a href="Fashion%20Week">Fashion Week</a> and writing feature articles for the magazine. In 2000, she was named Editor In Chief/Special Issues and Fashion Features Director for YM, and in 2001, she returned to GQ as Senior Editor and worked for her mentor, Art Cooper, until his retirement in 2003. Szish returned to broadcasting and worked as a <a href="freelance">freelance</a> producer and on-camera reporter for VOGUE's Trend Watch, a television show.
Television.
In 2004, Szish was named on-air correspondent for <a href="Us%20Weekly">Us Weekly</a>. From 2004 to 2007 Szish covered breaking celebrity news, style and <a href="popular%20culture">pop culture</a> and logged numerous television appearances on <a href="The%20Today%20Show">The Today Show</a>, <a href="The%20Early%20Show">The Early Show</a>, <a href="Good%20Morning%20America">Good Morning America</a>, <a href="The%20View%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">The View</a>, <a href="Entertainment%20Tonight">Entertainment Tonight</a>, "<a href="20/20%20%28US%20television%20series%29">20/20</a>", <a href="Larry%20King%20Live">Larry King Live</a>, <a href="The%20O%27Reilly%20Factor">The O'Reilly Factor</a>, <a href="Access%20Hollywood">Access Hollywood</a>, <a href="Inside%20Edition">Inside Edition</a>, <a href="MTV">MTV</a>, <a href="VH-1">VH-1</a>, <a href="History%20%28U.S.%20TV%20channel%29">The History Channel</a>, <a href="MSNBC">MSNBC</a>, <a href="HLN%20%28TV%20channel%29">HLN</a> and <a href="CNN">CNN</a>. Szish simultaneously served as a contributing anchor and host for <a href="ABC%20News%20Now">ABC News Now</a> and ABC News on MTV-U, as a columnist for ABCNEWS.com and as a correspondent for <a href="E%21">E!</a>'s "The Daily 10" and "Fashion Police". In 2006, Szish was tapped by <a href="The%20Food%20Network">The Food Network</a> to co-host a destination spa special. In 2007, Szish was named National Correspondent for <a href="InStyle">InStyle</a>. While at InStyle, Szish made regular appearances on The Today Show, TBS <a href="Movie%20and%20a%20Makeover">Movie and a Makeover</a>, CNN, CBS' The Early Show, and she garnered a recurring role on "<a href="Tim%20Gunn%27s%20Guide%20to%20Style">Tim Gunn's Guide to Style</a>" on BRAVO. In 2009, Szish left her full-time position at InStyle to pursue independent broadcasting, <a href="marketing">marketing</a> and <a href="new%20media">new media</a> projects. She worked with <a href="Toni%20Senecal">Toni Senecal</a> and <a href="WPIX">WPIX</a> Channel 11 as lifestyle correspondent for "Toni On New York." She remains a regular contributor to <a href="TBS%20%28U.S.%20TV%20channel%29">TBS</a>' "Movie & A Makeover," CNN, <a href="HLN%20%28TV%20channel%29">HLN</a>, <a href="CBS">CBS</a>, <a href="Fox%20News%20Channel">Fox News Channel</a> and <a href="Fox%20Business%20Network">Fox Business Network</a>.
Szish is a public speaker, addressing women and teens on life lessons and career advice. She is also involved in a variety of animal charity organizations including Amanda Hearst's <a href="Friends%20of%20Finn">Friends of Finn</a>.
